program.name: Emergency Medicaid
program.description:
Emergency Medicaid helps pay for emergency medical care for people who cannot get regular Medicaid because of their immigration status.

This program only covers medical emergencies. A medical emergency is when something happens suddenly that could seriously hurt your health if you don't get help right away. Examples include a bad injury, severe chest pain, or trouble breathing.

Emergency Medicaid does NOT cover regular doctor checkups, shots and vaccines, or medical care that can wait.

You don't need to apply before you have an emergency. If you go to the hospital or emergency room with a medical emergency, the hospital staff will help you find out if Emergency Medicaid can pay for that visit.
program.website_description: Health coverage for emergency medical conditions

documents.text: Proof of identity (ex: driver's license, state ID, passport, consular ID)
Proof of income (ex: pay stubs, tax returns, benefit statements showing all household income)
Proof of Illinois residency (ex: driver's license, utility bill, or mail with your name and address)
